abstract: CHONGQING, China - After the economies of Western nations imploded in late 2008, Chinese leaders began boasting of their nation's supremacy. Talk spread, not only in China but across the West, of the advantages of the so-called China model that was to be the guiding light for this century. Now it appears the sense of triumphalism was, at best, premature, and perhaps seriously misguided. Read more »

headline.main: China's Growth Slows, and Its Political Model Shows Limits
